prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, featuring a series of concentric ridges along its length. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0, and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.7453, 0.0. For the sketch, create a new face with the following loops and curves: * Loop 1: A circle with the center at (0.1491, 0.1491) and a radius of 0.1491. * Loop 2: A circle with the same center at (0.1491, 0.1491) and a radius of 0.0745. Then, set the sketch scale to 0.2981 and extrude the sketch by 0.3726 in the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Use the "New Body Feature Operation" to complete this part. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and sides that are parallel and meet at right angles. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0, and a translation vector of 0.2934, 0.7453, 0.1118. For the sketch, create a new face with the following loops and curves: * Loop 1: A line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.4566, 0.0), a line from (0.4566, 0.0) to (0.4566, 0.0745), and a line from (0.4566, 0.0745) to (0.0, 0.0745). The loop is closed by an arc from (0.0, 0.0745) to (0.0, 0.0) with a midpoint at (0.0047, 0.0373). Then, set the sketch scale to 0.4566 and extrude the sketch by 0.7453 in the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Use the "Join Feature Operation" to complete this part. The final shape of the CAD model will be a cylindrical object with a rectangular base, tapering towards the top, and a hole in the center. The length, width, and height of part 1 are 0.2981, 0.3726, and 0.2981 respectively. The length, width, and height of part 2 are 0.4566, 0.7453, and 0.4566 respectively. The final shape will have a length of 0.2981 + 0.4566 = 0.7547, a width of 0.3726, and a height of 0.4566.</description>
